meanings.definition: A condition of severely stunted physical and mental growth due to untreated congenital deficiency of thyroid hormones.
meanings.sent1: The doctor diagnosed the child with cretinism after noticing the developmental delays.
meanings.sent2: Cretinism can have serious effects on a person's overall health and well-being.
meanings.sent3: When the teacher asked the student why he didn't do his homework, he jokingly blamed it on cretinism.
meanings.sent4: The neglect of education in some areas can lead to a societal cretinism, hindering progress.
meanings.sent5: The image of the tiny, frail child suffering from cretinism stayed with the doctor long after the examination.

meanings.sent1: His decision to jump off the roof without a parachute was sheer cretinism.
meanings.sent2: She couldn't believe the level of cretinism displayed by her coworker during the meeting.
meanings.sent3: The comedian's act was filled with intentional cretinism to make the audience laugh.
meanings.sent4: Ignoring expert advice and going against common sense is a form of mental cretinism.
meanings.sent5: The consequences of his cretinism were evident when he lost all his savings in a get-rich-quick scheme.
